text: It’s been reported that Attorney General Barr overruled DOJ attorneys who recommended charges for the officer who killed Eric Garner. Barr needs to explain why he did this—why he decided that no charges should be brought in a case where a violent homicide was captured on video. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1151592430174658560 QT @thehill Booker demands answers from Barr over "disturbing decision" not to charge officer in Eric Garner killing https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/453579-booker-demands-answers-from-barr-on-lack-of-charges-in-garner-killing http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_tHNmwWwAcdVKi.jpg

Last night, I was with @IlhanMN when we heard people at Trump's rally were chanting “send her back."

She was unfazed. Sadly, she said, this racism isn't new.

Ilhan has incredible courage. She won’t back down to Trump’s hate, and neither will we. https://secure.actblue.com/donate/social-bernie-omar?refcode=tw190718 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_yC470XUAE32O9.png

@SenatorBaldwin @SenSherrodBrown @repmarkpocan @RepJayapal When I was a kid, my mom’s job at Sears saved our family. But that Sears doesn’t exist today. Neither does Payless, Shopko, or Gymboree. 

That’s because private equity & investment funds bought them, stripped them for parts, & drove them into the ground. #StopWallStreetLooting

At its core, abuses at the border are not about whether some CBP officers are good or bad people.

It’s about how our border policies are gravely dehumanizing, & strip all involved of human decency.

Once you order people to violate others’ rights, a culture can quickly devolve. https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1151982729912705024 QT @nowthisnews ‘You don’t think that having 10,000 officers in a violent, racist group sharing rape memes of members of Congress points to any concern of a dehumanized culture?’ — @AOC pressed DHS Sec. Kevin McAleenan after he denied a dehumanized culture within Border Patrol http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1151956127963406336/img/ndSOn6F0IG-h77Bj.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1151956127963406336/vid/320x320/MX0ELziunZ3NynuU.mp4?tag=13

Grateful for @RepAdamSchiff's partnership on my bill to require all health insurance to cover PrEP medication, required tests and doctors’ visits.

We must also address PrEP’s cost. Too many companies are putting profits before patients and that needs to end. https://twitter.com/RepAdamSchiff/status/1151536209853931521 QT @RepAdamSchiff PrEP is a life-changing drug that dramatically reduces the risk of HIV infection.
 
But due to the drug's high cost, those that would benefit most from PrEP never fill a Rx.
 
@SenKamalaHarris and I have introduced a bill to ensure PrEP is affordable and accessible to all: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_sSesSWsAgfOGM.jpg

Next, my plan would address the incentives that fuel useless speculation that can make bankers rich but undermines the rest of the economy. Washington has encouraged this speculation with giveaways, subsidies, and lax rules. I want to end these practices immediately.

Just look at the private equity industry. They buy companies and bleed them dry. And when the company fails, the Wall Street guys walk away with millions while workers are left holding the bag. It's legalized looting.

Here's the truth, I have consistently put forward amendments to offset the cost of proposals that spend your tax dollars and add to our deficit. This is no different. You can watch the entire interview here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sl0QlU99bik&feature=youtu.be http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_ydqq4XYAUhL26.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1151967962124967939/vid/480x270/Z2QtB90iG7xNx5Au.mp4?tag=13

Too many families face a choice of paying a late fee on their bills, an overdraft fee to the bank, or a sky-high interest rate to a payday lender while waiting on checks. The government should adopt real-time payment technology so families don't have to wait for checks to clear.

Read this thread. These tactics make a handful of Wall Street managers very rich, but are costing thousands of people their jobs, putting valuable companies out of business, and hurting communities across the country. https://twitter.com/TeamWarren/status/1151889101957869569 QT @TeamWarren Let's talk about private equity—the vampires of financial firms. Far too often, these firms follow a predictable pattern. They buy a company, transfer tons of debt onto them, then start sucking up “management” and “consulting” fees. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/D_xTtDgW4AAzdtl.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/D_xTtDgW4AAzdtl.mp4

Wall Street is scared. That’s why the big banks are building a “political machine” to keep Washington in their vice grip. I’m fighting back—and I’ve got a new plan to end Wall Street’s stranglehold on our economy. https://www.cnn.com/2019/07/18/politics/american-banking-association-2020-elections/index.html

RT @TXRandy14 “Apollo 50 Festival on the National Mall”: Over the next 2 days, they’re building a 20 foot model of the Space Launch System, #NASA’s rocket to take Americans back to the moon, in partnership with #LEGO to engage and involve children in science and space. #Back2theMoon #STEM http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_x58D5X4AUVVKI.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_x588WXsAUdQ-p.jpg

For decades, Washington has lived by one rule: If it’s good for Wall Street, it’s good for the economy. Today in Sioux City, Iowa, I talked about my new plan to change that rule. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_zgbyiXkAEzhuv.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1152038840250589186/vid/320x320/_puQX2-nueCTYVcZ.mp4?tag=13

For decades, Washington has lived by a simple rule: If it’s good for Wall Street, it’s good for the economy. But it just isn’t true. Big banks are making record profits and handing out huge bonuses as average wages barely budge.

I’ve spent a lot of my career studying how financial firms make money by tricking and trapping families. And after I proposed a new federal agency to protect consumers, I spent nearly a year setting up the @CFPB and helping write new rules to crack down on financial scams.

Finally, Wall Street sucks money away from companies that need it to grow. My Accountable Capitalism Act would end big companies catering to the short-term interests of Wall Street and let our companies focus on long-term growth and their obligations to workers.

Four years ago, @KeithEllison and I rallied with low wage workers for an increase in the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour.

We were laughed at. We were told it was unrealistic. We were told it wouldn't happen. 

Not anymore. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D_xdAOuX4AA9Oqo.jpg
And we need to end the system where bankers can make huge bonuses if risky bets pay off but lose nothing if they fail. I'll appoint regulators who will impose tough new rules to rein in banker pay.

Private equity firms want you to believe you’re not smart enough to understand their business model. But it's pretty simple: take over companies & loot 'em. 

And I’ve got a bill with @SenatorBaldwin, @SenSherrodBrown, @RepMarkPocan & @RepJayapal to fix it. #StopWallStreetLooting http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1151852632090300417/img/LGidUsO6j2U1BMJp.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1151852632090300417/vid/480x270/kYv88MP4q1kYyUs2.mp4?tag=13

"I was not happy with it. I disagree with it," he said. He was the first person to suggest she "go back" in a Sunday tweet.

The left wing politicians & many in the media demanding outrage are self righteous hypocrites

Our new #StopWallStreetLooting Act would:

✔️Put private investment funds on the hook for their companies' debt & liabilities
✔️End corporate looting through excessive fees & dividends
✔️Protects workers' jobs & severance
✔️Safeguard the markets from risky corporate debt

It’s not just stores at the mall that suffer from Wall Street looting. Private equity has ruined newspapers, manufactured housing, grocery stores, & even nursing homes in MA & across the country. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/opioid-overdoses-bedsores-and-broken-bones-what-happened-when-a-private-equity-firm-sought-profits-in-caring-for-societys-most-vulnerable/2018/11/25/09089a4a-ed14-11e8-baac-2a674e91502b_story.html

I was at dinner with Rep. Omar when we heard that people at Trump’s rally were chanting “send her back." 

Ilhan is a leader with courage. She won’t back down, and neither will we. 

Split a contribution between Ilhan’s campaign and our campaign today:

Today is historic.

A few years ago, people laughed and called us "crazy" when we called to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour.

Today, the U.S. House is voting on legislation to do just that.

That is what happens when working people build a movement for change.
